Articles.Content:
Hey y'all.

I thought I'd go out on a limb here and post my first thread. It took a while to get my V-2 to fly decently, but I got the proportions as close as I could to the real thing. I used a NovaPunch engine, procedural fairings, stretchy tanks, FASA, and some KWRocketry batteries. (I also used MechJeb on the ascent, so I could snap a few photos). I apologize up front if someone has already made a replica, but I'm new to the forums so I haven't really seen much.

http://imgur.com/a/DX58T#8

Also, I apologize if my images don't go through; I have no idea what I'm doing!

Edited January 30, 2014 by Tripside
Whoa.. nice. That looks absolutely like the V-2, but if you want the stabilizers to be right I'd reccomend using Procedural Wings. Other than that, that's an amazing looking rocket.
Thank you, it really means a lot.

While I was on Spaceport today I found some of BobCat's Soviet engine's pack, so I tried to make my own version of Soyuz with some stretchy tanks and some fairings and share the outcome with y'all...

Javascript is disabled. View full album
